section.title: Discontinuous Formulas
section.p: Discontinuities are a little more challenging to identify when working with formulas than when working with graphs. One reason for the added difficulty is that when working with a function formula you have to dig into your memory bank and retrieve fundamental properties about certain types of functions.

statement.p: What would cause a discontinuity on a rational function (a polynomial divided by another polynomial)?
If y is a function of u, defined by y=\fe{\ln}{u}, what is always true about the argument of the function, u, over intervals where the function is continuous?
Name three values of \theta where the function \fe{\tan}{\theta} is discontinuous.
What is the domain of the function k, where \fe{k}{t}=\sqrt{t-4}?
What is the domain of the function g, where \fe{g}{t}=\sqrt[3]{t-4}?
